title: Why People want to spend their Vacations in Africa? (Matteo Tramaglino)
text: By Matteo Tramaglino Jul 11, 2015 There is tremendous increase in the amount of visitors reaching Africa to explore the views there. Some places are really on demands. Here are some points based on them:Exploring Mount Kilimanjaro and Meru Trekking: In order to take benefit of the altitude acclimatization influence you need to climb Kilimanjaro and Mount Meru back to back. One should climb immediately climb Mt. Kilimanjaro after Mt. Meru. You arrive at the base of Mt. Meru, transport must be waiting there to move to Moshi or Marangu, and early the next day morning one start climbing Kilimanjaro.Knowing Big five African wildlife safaris: These are not other but the wildlife of Africa. It consists of Lion, Rhino, Leopard, Elephant and Buffalo.Great Serengeti migration in Tanzania: Annually more than a million wildebeest, antelope and zebra migrate clockwise nearby the Mara ecosystem of Serengeti/Masai, taking in 2 different nations and making time for courting, mating and birthing on the way.JANUARY: The herds from Tanzania's Serengeti are moving to south from the north-east area and into the south and Ndutu area of Serengeti, Ngorongoro Conservation area.FEBRUARY: The suitable grazing of the Ndutu, Ngorongoro and Southern Serengeti conservation area indicates the herds stay in the far south.MARCH:They are found in the south however the grasses have been munched up completely, they squeeze last calves and the herds are preparing for the next leg.APRIL: it is best if you are on the south part of the Serengeti plains - the wildebeest start their northward journey, as well as many have left by this time and are in the western and even central Serengeti.MAY: The huge columns of massed herds in length of up to 40km can be visible as the wildebeest direct up into the western and central Serengeti.JUNE: Head for the western and central Serengeti - the herds stays there and start to get some jittery. Visitors come from a long way to see Wildebeest migration in Serengeti.JULY: River crossings. The herds have influenced the Grumeti Reserves and western Serengeti and are anxiously peering at the river's brown waters they have to cross. It's due to Five-meter-long crocodiles.AUGUST: The survivors generally stumble up into the north part of the Serengeti and start crossing back into the National Reserve of Kenya's Masai Mara. Visiting Ngorongoro crater and Lake Manyara: Lake Manyara Park is the Tanzania's most noticeably located wildlife areas. The Ngorongoro Crater is a densely crammed African wildlife regions in the worldLake Victoria canoe touring:It is the largest freshwater lake of Africa and the world's 2nd largest after North America's Lake Superior. About the Author Matteo Tramaglino usually writes articles and blogs related to Tours and travels, in this article he writes about Great Serengeti migration in Tanzania and Big five African wildlife safaris .
